intro: Thaumatococcus daniellii var. daniellii, commonly known as African star apple, is a tropical plant native to West Africa. It is a member of the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces a fruit that is typically green when unripe and turns red when mature, with a sweet, aromatic pulp. The fruit is often consumed fresh or used in culinary applications due to its unique flavor and nutritional value. It thrives in humid, warm climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
